```{r}
# Load required libraries
library(dplyr)   # For data manipulation
library(ggplot2) # For data visualization

```



```{r}
# Load the CSV file using full path
employers_data <- read.csv("C:/Users/12165/Downloads/Employers.csv")

# Preview first few rows to check data
head(employers_data)

# Check structure of data (column types)
str(employers_data)

```


```{r}
# Ensure numeric columns are correctly detected
# Sometimes columns like Salary/Experience may be read as character if they have commas or special symbols
employers_data$Salary <- as.numeric(gsub(",", "", employers_data$Salary))
employers_data$Experience <- as.numeric(employers_data$Experience)

# Now summary of numeric variables
numeric_cols <- sapply(employers_data, is.numeric)
summary(employers_data[, numeric_cols])

```


```{r}
# Frequency table for categorical variables
table(employers_data$Department)
table(employers_data$Gender)
table(employers_data$Job_Title)
table(employers_data$Education_Level)
table(employers_data$Location)

```









```{r}
# Create a log-transformed Salary column
# Adding 1 to avoid log(0) errors
employers_data <- employers_data %>%
  mutate(LogSalary = log(Salary + 1))

# Summary of the new variable
summary(employers_data$LogSalary)

```

```{r}
# Histogram of Salary
ggplot(employers_data, aes(x = Salary)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 20000, fill="steelblue", color="black") +
  labs(title="Distribution of Salaries", x="Salary", y="Count")

```



```{r}
# Scatterplot of Experience_Years vs Salary
ggplot(employers_data, aes(x = Experience_Years, y = Salary)) +
  geom_point(color="darkred") +
  labs(title="Experience vs Salary", x="Years of Experience", y="Salary")

```
